docs.lead_paragraph: The 1980 Republican platform was considered a triumph for conservatives. But they are even happier this year.

headline.seo: Republican Platform Takes Turn to Right
headline.main: Platform’s Sharp Turn to Right Has Conservatives Cheering
headline.print_headline: Platform’s Sharp Turn to the Right Has Conservatives Cheering

docs.abstract: Republicans at national convention adopt platform which shows just how far rightward the party has shifted in both tone and substance since it adopted the 1980 platform, which was considered a triumph for conservatives at the time; platform keeps its focus on party's traditional support for low taxes, national security and social conservatism, and delves into a number of politically charged issues.
docs.snippet: The 1980 Republican platform was considered a triumph for conservatives. But they are even happier this year.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican- and Democratic-controlled states alike have reduced or largely eliminated dental coverage for adults on Medicaid.

headline.main: Sharp Cuts in Dental Coverage for Adults on Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Hard to Grin While Bearing Cuts in Medicaid Dental Coverage

docs.abstract: Republican- and Democratic-controlled states alike have reduced or largely eliminated dental coverage for millions of poor adults on Medicaid, the shared state and federal health insurance program for poor people; situation is not likely to improve under Pres Obama's health care overhaul, as it requires dental coverage for children only.
docs.snippet: Republican- and Democratic-controlled states alike have reduced or largely eliminated dental coverage for adults on Medicaid.

docs.lead_paragraph: Angela Braly will be replaced by John Cannon, the company’s executive vice president, while the company searches for a replacement.

headline.seo: WellPoint C.E.O. Resigns After Drop in Sales
headline.main: WellPoint C.E.O. Resigns as Sales Fall
headline.print_headline: WellPoint C.E.O. Resigns as Sales Fall

docs.abstract: WellPoint chief executive Angela F Braly steps down after disappointing sales and a reduced forecast caused by rising costs and lower membership; company will look at internal and external candidates for a successor.
docs.snippet: Angela Braly will be replaced by John Cannon, the company’s executive vice president, while the company searches for a replacement.

docs.lead_paragraph: A former insurance company chief executive writes that the Romney-Ryan plan will increase the country’s health care bill.
docs.snippet: A former insurance company chief executive writes that the Romney-Ryan plan will increase the country’s health care bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama campaign is trying to expand its numbers and support among young voters, a group that tends to go to the polls at lower rates than older voters.

headline.seo: Obama, on College Campuses, Seeks Students’ Votes
headline.main: Obama Courts the Votes of a Less-Engaged Youth
headline.print_headline: With Visits to Campuses, Obama Keeps Campaigning

docs.abstract: Pres Obama makes a tour of college campuses in aggressive appeal for young voters, a group that tends to go to the polls at lower rates than older voters.
docs.snippet: The Obama campaign is trying to expand its numbers and support among young voters, a group that tends to go to the polls at lower rates than older voters.

byline.contributor: Carl Hulse contributed reporting from Denver.

docs.lead_paragraph: A retired corporate lawyer urges a broader sense of responsibility from business. Readers are invited to respond.

headline.print_headline: Invitation to a Dialogue: The Corporate Citizen

docs.lead_paragraph: The F.D.I.C. quarterly report showed the banking industry earned $34.5 billion in the second quarter, up $5.9 billion from a year earlier.

headline.seo: Earnings for Banks Are Up, Though Weakened by JPMorgan’s Loss
headline.main: Banks’ Financial Health Improves, F.D.I.C. Says
headline.print_headline: Banks’ Financial Health Improves, F.D.I.C. Says

docs.snippet: The F.D.I.C. quarterly report showed the banking industry earned $34.5 billion in the second quarter, up $5.9 billion from a year earlier.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Democrats are giving a convention speaking slot to Sister Simone Campbell, an outspoken advocate for the poor and elderly, according to an aide with President Obama's campaign who would speak only on background. In doing so, the Democratic Party has balanced its own Catholic ticket by showcasing both Sister Campbell, who pushed for the passage of the Obama administration's health care overhaul, and Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan of New York, who is suing the White House over a provision in the health care overhaul that requires employers to cover birth control in their employee insurance plans.

headline.main: The Democratic Convention: Speaking Slot for Outspoken Nun

docs.abstract: Caucus column; Democrats are giving a speaking slot at the Democratic National Convention to Sister Simone Campbell, an outspoken advocate for the poor and the elderly. Photo (M)
